title: The Perfect Roast Turkey
description: This isn't just a roast turkey - it's a masterclass in poultry perfection, inspired by Alton Brown's scientific approach. The secret lies in a precise brining process, calculated temperature control, and strategic aromatics placement. The result is a perfectly golden-brown bird with juicy breast meat, properly cooked dark meat, and crispy skin.

brine.name: kosher salt
brine.notes: Diamond Crystal (if using Morton's, use 3/4 cup)

turkey.name: whole turkey
turkey.notes: Fresh preferred, if frozen thaw in refrigerator 4-5 days ahead

basting mixture.name: mixed fresh herbs
basting mixture.notes: Finely chopped mix of sage, thyme, and rosemary

instructions.text: BRINE PREPARATION (2-3 DAYS BEFORE): Combine vegetable stock, salt, brown sugar, peppercorns, allspice berries, and candied ginger in a large stockpot. Bring to a boil, stirring to dissolve salt and sugar. Remove from heat, cool to room temperature, then refrigerate until thoroughly chilled.

BRINING (24-36 HOURS BEFORE): Combine chilled brine with ice water in a large container. Clean turkey by removing giblets and neck (reserve for gravy). Immerse turkey in brine, breast side down, weight with a plate if necessary to keep submerged. Refrigerate for 24-36 hours.

AIR DRY (NIGHT BEFORE): Remove turkey from brine, rinse inside and out under cold water. Place on a rack over a rimmed baking sheet. Pat dry thoroughly with paper towels. Refrigerate uncovered overnight to dry the skin.

PREPARATION (DAY OF): Remove turkey from refrigerator 1 hour before roasting. Preheat oven to 500°F with rack in lowest position. Combine apple, onion, cinnamon stick, and herbs in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high for 5 minutes.
STUFF AND TRUSS: Place aromatic mixture inside turkey cavity along with orange quarters. Tuck wing tips behind back. Tie legs together with kitchen twine. Pat skin dry again.
INITIAL ROAST: Place turkey on roasting rack in a large roasting pan. Brush with half the herb butter. Roast at 500°F for 30 minutes until skin begins to brown.
TEMPERATURE ADJUSTMENT: Insert probe thermometer into thickest part of breast. Reduce oven temperature to 350°F. Add 2 cups water to roasting pan.

MAIN ROAST: Continue roasting, brushing with remaining butter halfway through, until internal temperature reaches exactly 157°F in breast and 175°F in thigh, about 2-2.5 hours total for a 14-16 pound bird.
RESTING: Remove from oven, tent loosely with foil, and let rest for exactly 30 minutes. During this time, the temperature will rise to 165°F in the breast through carryover cooking.
CARVING: Remove twine and aromatics. Carve turkey, starting with legs and thighs, then wings, then breast meat cut against the grain.

notes: BRINING SCIENCE: The salt solution alters protein structures, helping the meat retain moisture during cooking. The sugar aids in browning and balances the salt.
TEMPERATURE CONTROL: The initial high heat (500°F) creates a moisture barrier in the skin. The lower temperature (350°F) then allows for even cooking.
TIMING GUIDE: Plan backwards from serving time: 30 minutes rest + 2-2.5 hours roasting + 1 hour tempering + overnight drying + 24-36 hours brining.
DONENESS: The target temperature of 157°F might seem low, but carryover cooking will bring it to the safe temperature of 165°F while keeping the meat juicy.
VARIATIONS: For a smaller turkey (under 14 pounds), reduce cooking time accordingly. For larger turkeys, spatchcock (butterfly) for more even cooking.
LEFTOVERS: Carve all remaining meat off bones within 2 hours. Store meat and bones separately. Bones can be used for stock.
SAFETY: Never stuff a brined turkey with traditional stuffing - the salt content will make it inedible. Use aromatics only.
